page.title: 12TOURISTS IN ETON
page.content: Tourists visiting Windsor Castle often cross the bridge,which is now closed to traffic,to walk through Eton to Eton College.The college buildings, situated above Baldwins bridge, are many and varied , but there is no mistaking the heart of the College,the Chapel,which was built for Henry VI. We spent half an hour on the bridge asking people where they had come from.Most were from the U.S.A. and Japan,others were from Germany,Brazil, New Zealand,Australia and Korea. Some tourists come in the Windsor tour bus, a white double-decker which has to come a long way round to reach the High Street as it can't cross the bridge. Tourists often spend money in the Eton shops ,pubs and restaurants.
